title: Why doesn't school teach you how to make money? - Quora

response.answer_text: Before industrial age, we as individual, were our own boss. Most where in agriculture. During Industrial age, the industries need workers who keep silent and doesn't ask much question. That's the time they started giving class room education by closing us inside wall and keeping us to be silent. We are trained well to be technical and to be controlled under authority, also made us think that's how the world work and we should be proud about it. 10% people they know end goals is to make money and have time for themselves-financial freedom 90% people have only mean goals and process oriented about making money and no personal time— retirement 10% people owns the school, 90% just get degree from them  Why will 10% people will teach you the secret and lose their wealth? The creative and smart people move from 90% →10% soon.

Do you really want to know? Because if you knew how to become rich, you would become a contributing, self-supporting member of society, who knew how to think for yourself. You would not be applying for food stamps, or other welfare benefits. Do you realize how many bureaucrats administering those programs would be thrown out of work because of people like you? The government has,a vested interest in keeping you “Dumbed Down” so you will always be dependent on it. There are plenty of legal ways to get rich SLOWLY so you can have a seven figure at retirement, but you’ll have to learn them outside the public school system!
